Excercise 1
types.js
var myString = "aidan";
var myNumber = 69;
var myBoolean = true;


// Do not edit the code under this line
console.log("Name: " + myString);
console.log("Lucky Number: " + myNumber);
console.log("Good joke? " + myBoolean);

Excercise 2
console.js
console.log('My favourite pizza is a margerita with chicken, ham, red onions and tuna. It is delicious. ');

Excercise 3
mathOperators.js
var myAge= 22;
var mars= 3*5;
console.log('The age I will be when we send people to mars: '); 
console.log(myAge+mars);

console.log('How many years since the 1969 moon landing: ');
console.log(2016-1969);


console.log(65 / 240);

console.log(0.27083 * 100);

Excercise 4
mathOperators2.js
console.log(365/27);
console.log(365%27);

Excercise 5
random.js
console.log(Math.random() * 100);

console.log(Math.floor(Math.random() * 100));

Excercise 6
comments.je
//Opening line.
console.log('It was love at first sight.');

/*console.log('The first time Yossarian saw the chaplain he fell madly in love with him.');
console.log('Yossarian was in the hospital with a pain in his liver that fell just short of being jaundice.');
console.log('The doctors were puzzled by the fact that it wasn\'t quite jaundice.');
console.log('If it became jaundice they could treat it.');
console.log('If it didn\'t become jaundice and went away they could discharge him.');
*/console.log('But this just being short of jaundice all the time confused them.');

Excercise 7
createVariable.js

var strength='50,000 pounds';
console.log('How much stuff can a variable hold/ ', strength);

Excercise 8
createVariables.js
var strength='50,000 pounds';
var age=22;
var hasPet=true;

console.log('How much stuff can a variable hold/ ', strength);
console.log(age);
console.log(hasPet);
